verses.verse: And I gave her time (Rom. 2:5; Rev. 9:20; 16:9, 11) to repent of her sexual immorality, and she did not repent.
Indeed I will cast her into a sickbed, and those who commit adultery with her into great tribulation, unless they repent of their deeds.

I will kill her children with death, and all the churches shall know that I am He who (Ps. 7:9; 26:2; 139:1; Jer. 11:20; 17:10; Matt. 16:27; Luke 16:15; Acts 1:24; Rom. 8:27) searches the minds and hearts. And I will give to each one of you according to your works.

“Now to you I say, and to the rest in Thyatira, as many as do not have this doctrine, who have not known the (2 Tim. 3:1-9) depths of Satan, as they say, (Acts 15:28) I will put on you no other burden.
But hold fast (Rev. 3:11) what you have till I come.
And he who overcomes, and keeps ((John 6:29)) My works until the end, ((Matt. 19:28)) to him I will give power over the nations—
‘He (Ps. 2:8, 9; Rev. 12:5; 19:15) shall rule them with a rod of iron; They shall be dashed to pieces like the potter’s vessels’ — as I also have received from My Father;
and I will give him (2 Pet. 1:19; Rev. 22:16) the morning star.
“He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’

The Dead Church “And to the angel of the church in Sardis write, ‘These things says He who (Rev. 1:4, 16) has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars: “I know your works, that you have a name that you are alive, but you are dead.
Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die, for I have not found your works perfect before God.

(1 Tim. 6:20) Remember therefore how you have received and heard; hold fast and (Rev. 3:19) repent. (Matt. 24:42, 43; Luke 12:39) Therefore if you will not watch, I will come upon you (1 Thess. 5:2; (2 Pet. 3:10; Rev. 16:15)) as a thief, and you will not know what hour I will come upon you.
You have (Acts 1:15) a few names even in Sardis who have not ((Jude 23)) defiled their garments; and they shall walk with Me (Rev. 4:4; 6:11) in white, for they are worthy.

He who overcomes ((Rev. 19:8)) shall be clothed in white garments, and I will not (Ex. 32:32; Ps. 69:28; Luke 10:20; (Rev. 13:8; 17:8; 20:12, 15; 21:27)) blot out his name from the (Phil. 4:3) Book of Life; but (Matt. 10:32; Luke 12:8) I will confess his name before My Father and before His angels.
(Rev. 2:7) “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’

The Faithful Church “And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write, ‘These things says (Acts 3:14) He who is holy, (John 14:6; 1 John 5:20; Rev. 3:14; 19:11) He who is true, (Is. 9:7; 22:22; Jer. 23:5) “He who has the key of David, ((Matt. 16:19; Rev. 1:18)) He who opens and no one shuts, and (Job 12:14) shuts and no one opens” :
(Rev. 3:1) “I know your works. See, I have set before you (1 Cor. 16:9) an open door, and no one can shut it; for you have a little strength, have kept My word, and have not denied My name.

Indeed I will make (Rev. 2:9) those of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews and are not, but lie—indeed (Is. 45:14; 49:23; 60:14) I will make them come and worship before your feet, and to know that I have loved you.

Because you have kept My command to persevere, (2 Tim. 2:12; 2 Pet. 2:9) I also will keep you from the hour of trial which shall come upon (Luke 2:1) the whole world, to test those who dwell (Is. 24:17) on the earth.
Behold, (Phil. 4:5) I am coming quickly! (Rev. 2:25) Hold fast what you have, that no one may take ((Rev. 2:10)) your crown.

He who overcomes, I will make him (1 Kin. 7:21; Jer. 1:18; Gal. 2:9) a pillar in the temple of My God, and he shall (Ps. 23:6) go out no more. ((Rev. 14:1; 22:4)) I will write on him the name of My God and the name of the city of My God, the ((Heb. 12:22)) New Jerusalem, which (Rev. 21:2) comes down out of heaven from My God. ((Rev. 2:17; 22:4)) And I will write on him My new name.
(Rev. 2:7) “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’
